meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of a siphon.
meanings.sent1: The syphonal design of the water pump helped it move liquid efficiently.
meanings.sent2: The syphonal tube allowed the water to flow smoothly from one container to another.
meanings.sent3: The syphonal shape of the straw made drinking soda more fun.
meanings.sent4: Her hair, cascading down her back, resembled the syphonal flow of a waterfall.
meanings.sent5: The syphonal structure of the bridge resembled a graceful curve in the landscape.

meanings.sent1: The syphonal fish had specialized organs for siphoning water.
meanings.sent2: The syphonal insects used their proboscis as a siphon to feed on nectar.
meanings.sent3: The syphonal birds had beaks that acted like tiny siphons for drinking water.
meanings.sent4: The syphonal plants absorbed nutrients through their root system like a siphon.
meanings.sent5: The syphonal machine had multiple tubes that functioned as siphons for different liquids.

meanings.sent1: The syphonal mechanism automatically started siphoning water when the tank was full.
meanings.sent2: The syphonal device efficiently transferred liquid from one container to another.
meanings.sent3: The syphonal contraption made pouring drinks feel like a science experiment.
meanings.sent4: The syphonal system worked silently, drawing water up through the pipes.
meanings.sent5: The syphonal pump operated smoothly, creating a continuous flow of water.
